title: Schema validation of any KrakenD version using syntax version=3

version.title: Version of this syntax
version.description: The syntax version tells KrakenD how to read this configuration. This is not the KrakenD version. Each KrakenD version is linked to a syntax version.

host.title: Default host
host.description: The default host list for all backends if they specify none.

sequential_start.title: Sequential start
sequential_start.description:
A sequential start registers all async agents in order, allowing you to have the starting logs in sequential order. A non-sequential start is much faster, but logs are harder to follow. Defaults to false.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/

name.title: Name
name.description: Used in telemetry. A friendly name, title, date, version or any other short description that helps you recognize the configuration.

port.title: Port
port.description: The TCP port where KrakenD is listening to. Recommended value is in the range 1024-65535 to run as an unpriviliged user

timeout.title: Global timeout
timeout.description:
Defines a default timeout for all endpoints. Can be overriden per endpoint.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/#global-timeout

cache_ttl.title: Cache TTL
cache_ttl.description: The default time you will allow external proxies to cache this content. It's added in the Cache-Control header.

output_encoding.title: Output Encoding
output_encoding.description:
The encoding used to display the content to the end-user.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/endpoints/content-types/

read_timeout.title: HTTP read timeout
read_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Server settings: Maximum duration for reading the entire HTTP request, including the body.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/

read_header_timeout.title: HTTP Idle timeout
read_header_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Server settings: Amount of time allowed to read request headers.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/

write_timeout.title: HTTP write timeout
write_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Server settings: Maximum duration before timing out writes of the response.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/

idle_timeout.title: HTTP Idle timeout
idle_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Server settings: Maximum amount of time to wait for the next request when keep-alives are enabled.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-server-settings/

dialer_timeout.title: Dialer Timeout
dialer_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
The timeout of the dial function for creating connections.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

dialer_keep_alive.title: Dialer keep alive
dialer_keep_alive.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
The amount of time you want to keep alive the connection. If zero, keep-alives are not enabled.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

dialer_fallback_delay.title: Dialer fallback delay
dialer_fallback_delay.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
Specifies the length of time to wait before spawning a RFC 6555 Fast Fallback connection.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

disable_compression.title: Disable compression
disable_compression.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
When true prevents requesting compression with an `Accept-Encoding: gzip`

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

disable_keep_alives.title: Disable keep alives
disable_keep_alives.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
When true it disables HTTP keep-alives and will only use the connection to the server for a single HTTP request.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

max_idle_connections.title: Max idle connections
max_idle_connections.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
The maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. Zero means no limit.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

max_idle_connections_per_host.title: Max idle connections per host
max_idle_connections_per_host.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
If non-zero, controls the maximum idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If zero, the default (2) is used.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

idle_connection_timeout.title: HTTP Idle timeout
idle_connection_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
The maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. Zero means no limit.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

response_header_timeout.title: Response header timeout
response_header_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
If non-zero, specifies the amount of time to wait for a server’s response headers after fully writing the request (including its body, if any). This time does not include the time to read the response body.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

expect_continue_timeout.title: Expect_continue_timeout
expect_continue_timeout.description:
Advanced HTTP Transport settings
If non-zero, specifies the amount of time to wait for a server’s first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an `Expect: 100-continue` header. Zero means no timeout and causes the body to be sent immediately, without waiting for the server to approve. This time does not include the time to send the request header.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/http-transport-settings/

disable_rest.title: Disable RESTful URLs
disable_rest.description: Only RESTful URL patterns are valid to access backends. Set to true if your backends aren't RESTful, e.g.: /url.{some_variable}.json

tls.title: TLS
tls.description: Use TLS for HTTPS and HTTP/2

public_key.title: Public key
public_key.description:
Absolute path to the public key, or relative to the current working directory.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

private_key.title: Private key
private_key.description:
Absolute path to the private key, or relative to the current working directory.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

disabled.title: Disable TLS
disabled.description:
A flag to disable TLS (useful while in development).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

enable_mtls.title: Enable Mutual Authentication
enable_mtls.description:
Whether to enable or not Mutual Authentication. When mTLS is enabled, all KrakenD endpoints require clients to provide a known client-side X.509 authentication certificate. KrakenD relies on the system’s CA to validate certificates.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/mutual-authentication/

curve_preferences.title: Curve identifiers
curve_preferences.description:
The list of all the identifiers for the curve preferences.
(use 23 for CurveP256, 24 for CurveP384 or 25 for CurveP521)

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

prefer_server_cipher_suites.title: Prefer server cipher suites
prefer_server_cipher_suites.description:
Enforces the use of one of the cipher suites offered by the server, instead of going with the suite proposed by the client.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/authorization/mutual-authentication/

cipher_suites.title: Cipher Suites
cipher_suites.description:
The list of cipher suites

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/service-settings/tls/

plugin.title: Plugin
plugin.description: Enables external plugins that are copied in a specific folder

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: The pattern narrows down the contents of the folder. It represents the substring that must be present in the plugin name to load.

folder.title: Folder
folder.description: The path in the filesystem where all the plugins you want to load are. MUST END IN SLASH. The folder can be a relative or absolute path. KrakenD Enterprise uses /opt/krakend/plugins/ for all plugins.
